title: Add social media and streaming link buttons

requirements.text: Update the Home page social link buttons to better support “social media app links” and “streaming” links by rendering platform-specific buttons (icon + platform name/label) instead of the generic “Follow” label, while still using the existing `artistProfile.socials: [Text]` URLs as the data source.

quotes: add socola mediapp link and steming staem and etc buutom

acceptanceCriteria: On `/`, each URL in `profile.socials` renders as a visible button with an icon and a readable platform label (e.g., “Spotify”, “Apple Music”, “YouTube”, “Instagram”, “X”, “Facebook”) when the platform can be detected from the URL.
Unknown/unrecognized URLs still render as a button with a generic external-link icon and a non-empty label (e.g., “Link”).
All social/streaming buttons open in a new tab and preserve `rel="noopener noreferrer"`.
No backend changes are required; links continue to be managed via the existing Admin Profile editor social links field.

requirements.text: Update the Music/Releases page streaming link buttons to render platform-specific buttons (icon + platform name/label) derived from each `release.streamingLinks` URL instead of the generic “Listen” label, so users can easily recognize each streaming destination.

quotes: add socola mediapp link and steming staem and etc buutom

acceptanceCriteria: On `/music`, each URL in `release.streamingLinks` renders as a button with an icon and a platform label when detectable from the URL (e.g., “Spotify”, “Apple Music”, “YouTube Music”, “SoundCloud”, etc.).
If a streaming URL is not recognized, it still renders as a button with a generic external-link icon and a non-empty label (e.g., “Listen”).
All streaming buttons open in a new tab and preserve `rel="noopener noreferrer"`.
Existing admin functionality for adding/removing streaming links remains unchanged and continues to drive what appears on the public page.

constraints: Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only shadcn components).
Do not modify the Internet Identity hooks in immutable paths (`frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`/`.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`).
Keep the backend single-actor architecture; do not introduce additional canisters/services.
nonGoals: Adding new backend data fields for social/streaming links (continue using the existing URL arrays).
Adding third-party API integrations for social/streaming platforms.
Changing authentication, admin authorization, or plans features.
